intro: Cacalia citrina, commonly known as yellow thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in rocky or disturbed soils. The plant features bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple-tinged base, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture and spiny margins. Cacalia citrina is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
